akn:content.akn:p: “Constituent limited partnership” means a domestic or foreign limited partnership that is a party to a merger.
“Governing statute” of a domestic or foreign limited partnership means the statute that governs the partnership’s internal affairs.

“Personal liability” means personal liability for a debt, liability, or other obligation of a limited partnership which is imposed on a person that co-owns, has an interest in, or is a member of the limited partnership by the limited partnership’s:

“Surviving limited partnership” means a domestic or foreign limited partnership into which one or more other domestic or foreign limited partnerships are merged. A surviving limited partnership may preexist the merger or be created by the merger.
